title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Keep Him on Colorado Ballot
description: Donald Trump urged the US Supreme Court to clear him to run for president in a case that’s become an historic test of the Constitution’s insurrection clause and has the potential to alter the course of the 2024 election.

title: Hunter Biden to Give Private Deposition in Impeachment Probe
description: Presidential son Hunter Biden is scheduled to appear for a Feb. 28 closed-door deposition on his overseas business activities, which are at the center of House Republicans’ impeachment inquiry into Joe Biden.

title: Big GOP Donors Dreading Trump-Biden Rematch Stay on Sidelines
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Washington correspondent Saleha Mohsin talks for her podcast with billionaire investor and GOP donor Kyle Bass about the presidential race. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Wall Street Is Running Out of Time to Influence the GOP Nomination <!--EndFragment-->
description: Big-money investors are holding back on their donations in the GOP primaries, wishing for a Trump alternative

title: Ukraine Detains Investment Banker Who Complained of Corruption
description: Ukrainian authorities have detained an investment banker in an investigation involving a real estate project, but his company said the detention was retribution for his complaints about law enforcement pressure on business.

title: A Hindu Temple Embodies the Rise of Modi and India's Deep Divisions
description: Ahead of national elections, the opening of a controversial temple illustrates a religious fault line in India — and how high Modi’s party has climbed.

title: US Prepares Rule Forcing Banks to Tap Fed Discount Window
description: US regulators are preparing to introduce a plan to require that banks tap the Federal Reserve’s discount window at least once a year to reduce the stigma and ensure lenders are ready for troubled times.

title: Biden Hits Trump, Saying 2024 Rival Wants Stock Market Crash
description: President Joe Biden lambasted Donald Trump for comments casting the US as a “failing nation,” plugging his agenda in a Republican-leaning state he aims to pick up in November’s election.

title: Israel Vows to Control Security in the Gaza Strip After the War
description: Israel will insist on security control over the West Bank and Gaza Strip in the foreseeable future after the war, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, rejecting rule by the Palestinian Authority despite calls from the US.

title: Trump Prosecutor Scandal Exposed as Divorce Grew Rancorous
description: Nathan Wade filed for divorce a day after Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis hired him in 2021 to lead the Georgia investigation that resulted in election conspiracy charges against Donald Trump and 18 allies.

title: Senate Passes Temporary Funding to Avert US Government Shutdown
description: The Senate passed a temporary spending bill to avert a partial US government shutdown this weekend, sending it to the House where it is on track to clear the chamber later Thursday.

title: Why the Argentine Peso Is Slipping Through Milei’s Fingers
description: The respite that President Javier Milei brought to Argentina’s parallel exchange rate has proved all too short as the peso slides to fresh lows in the unofficial market used to skirt capital controls.

title: Trump Prosecutor Smith Reined In by Judge Who Paused Jan. 6 Case
description: The federal judge overseeing the criminal election interference case against Donald Trump limited what prosecutors can do while the case is on hold.

title: German Budget Lawmakers Approve Net New Borrowing of €39 Billion
description: German budget lawmakers late Thursday approved the federal government’s delayed finance plan for 2024, which restores a constitutional limit on net new borrowing for the first time since 2019.

title: Dutch King Risks Losing Half His Pay From Tax Proposal
description: King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands is on the verge of losing almost half his paycheck as the country’s parliament prepares to vote on a proposal to tax his income — just like those of his subjects.

title: What Is the Child Tax Credit, and Will It Go Up?
description: A roughly $80 billion tax package under consideration in the US Congress includes an expansion of the child tax credit — a mechanism by which American families reduce the federal taxes they owe. The credit would become adjustable for inflation for tax years 2024 and 2025, and more of it would be refundable to families with low earnings. First, though, the tax package — which also includes renewing expired business tax breaks — must make it through negotiations and debate on Capitol Hill.

title: Poland’s New Cabinet Rejects Top Court Ruling on State Media Overhaul
description: Poland’s government said it would ignore a ruling by the Constitutional Court that the appointment of new executives to state media by the Donald Tusk cabinet was unconstitutional.

title: Thousands Protest in Slovakia to Stop Prime Minister’s Judiciary Revamp
description: Thousands of demonstrators took to the streets across Slovakia to protest a proposed overhaul of the judiciary by Prime Minister Robert Fico, the European Union’s latest leader accused of eroding democratic standards and the rule of law.

title: Google to Invest $1 Billion in New UK Data Center to Meet Demand
description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google said it is investing $1 billion in a new data center in the UK to help meet growing demand for its services, a boost for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservative government as it tries to position Britain as a world leader in tech.

title: US, China Fight for One Pacific Nation Mirrors a Regional Battle
description: As leaders from across the Pacific, and special envoys from the US and China, descended on the Cook Islands in November for the region’s largest annual forum, they couldn’t have failed to notice the main island’s sports arena, or the capital city’s police station, or its Department of Justice.

title: Rutte’s Backers Are Pushing to Lock Him in as NATO’s Next Leader
description: Countries supporting Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte’s bid to lead NATO have been working behind the scenes to make sure the race is wrapped up by this summer, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Blinken to Discuss Security, Health, Development on Africa Visit
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken will use his visit to four African nations next week to discuss economic development, health and security.

title: Biden Says US Will Continue Houthi Strikes, Although Group Undeterred
description: President Joe Biden said US air strikes against Iran-backed Houthi militants in Yemen will continue even though they have not halted the group’s attacks on Red Sea shipping.

title: Trump Tax Leaker Acted Out of ‘Deep, Moral Belief,’ Judge Told
description: The former Internal Revenue Service contractor who admitted stealing and leaking the tax returns of former President Donald Trump and other billionaires acted out of a “deep, moral belief” that Americans had a right to the information, his lawyers told a judge.

title: Estonia Expels Russian Orthodox Leader on Security Concerns
description: Estonian authorities revoked the residency permit of the Russian Orthodox Church’s top cleric in the Baltic nation, where authorities have long accused the spiritual leader of supporting the Kremlin’s war.

title: Petroperu Is Asking for Nearly $2 Billion in Government Support
description: State-owned Petroleos del Peru SA is seeking nearly $2 billion in government support, its chairman said as the battered company runs out of cash.

title: Norway Loses Court Battle With Climate Groups on Oil, Gas Fields
description: Climate activists won a court case in Norway against the state over development plans at a handful of oil and gas fields under the sea off the Nordic country’s coast.

title: Italy Set to Nationalize Steelmaker Owned by ArcelorMittal
description: The government of Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is set to seize control of the country’s top steelmaker from its main shareholder ArcelorMittal SA after talks failed.

title: Labour Vows to Work With Tech Firms Seeking UK Listing
description: A Labour government will work with technology firms that want to list their shares in London, the party’s business spokesman said, as the UK’s main opposition seeks to burnish its business credentials ahead of an election expected in the fall.

title: Lindner Says Too Much German Public Spending Would Undermine ECB
description: Germany can’t go on a public spending spree as this would undermine the European Central Bank’s efforts to tame inflation, according to Finance Minister Christian Lindner.

title: EU Eyes New Fund to Boost Spending on Dual-Use Technologies
description: The European Union should consider creating a dedicated fund to boost the development of technologies that can serve both military and civil purposes, as part of its effort to ensure the bloc’s economic security.

title: Why Pakistan and Iran Attacked Each Other
description: Relations between Pakistan and Iran have by and large been cordial, although they’ve sparred intermittently over attacks by militants along their porous 900-kilometer-long (560-mile-long) border. Tensions have flared anew, with the two Muslim nations conducting strikes in each other’s territories. The first attack, from Iran, came shortly after it had fired missiles at what it alleged was an Israeli spy base in Iraq and at Islamic State targets in Syria — a notable show of force after Iranian ta

title: Trudeau Must Stop the Flow of Asylum Seekers, Says Quebec Leader
description: Quebec is close to a breaking point with asylum seekers arriving in the French-speaking province, says Premier Francois Legault in a letter sent to Primer Minister Justin Trudeau.

title: Houthis Say They’re Improving Military Might in Defiance of US
description: Yemen’s Houthis vowed they would keep attacking ships in the Red Sea, even after the US launched a fourth round of missiles strikes against them.

title: Ukraine Seeks to Organize Call with China’s Xi to Push Leaders Summit
description: Ukraine’s top diplomat said Kyiv is seeking to organize a call with Chinese President Xi Jinping as the war-battered nation plans a leaders summit to push forward its blueprint for peace.

title: Biden’s New Student Debt Plan Faces Pressure From Civil Rights, Labor Groups
description: President Joe Biden is facing pressure from nearly 70 advocacy groups to broaden the scope of an alternative debt-relief plan the administration is set to release, changes they say are necessary to help blocs crucial to his re-election campaign including young people and people of color.

title: Italy Plans to Sell €2 Billion Eni Stake to Reduce Debt
description: Italy’s government is planning the sale of up to 4% of Eni SpA after the oil company completes a buy-back plan, a deal which would allow Rome to reduce its mammoth debt.

title: ‘Toxic’ Attacks on ESG Lead Wall Street to Mount a New Defense
description: Climate alliances backed by Wall Street heavyweights have struck upon a subtle way to blunt increasingly aggressive attacks by the GOP.

title: Airstrikes on Yemen Bring New Level of Chaos to Shipping in the Southern Red Sea
description: The US and UK’s decision to hit back at Houthi militants after weeks of attacks on merchant shipping in the Red Sea has only escalated the chaos across the shipping industry, underscoring the threat of an enduring supply-chain crisis as vessels navigate the crucial trade route.

title: Hackers Stole $7.5 Million in Grant Money From US Health Department
description: Hackers stole millions of dollars in grant money from the Department of Health and Human Services last year in a series of attacks, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: Israel Calls on World to Help Free Hostages Held in Gaza
description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog called on the world to “work endlessly” to free the 136 Israeli and foreign hostages held by Hamas in Gaza.

title: Poland Sends Anti-Corruption Officers to Energy Company Orlen
description: Officers from Poland’s anti-corruption agency visited the headquarters of the country’s largest company as Donald Tusk’s government prepares to take over the management of state-controlled firms.

title: A Plan But No Planes: Tory Divisions Deepen As Rwanda Vote Passes
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Musk Will Attend Auschwitz Event to Discuss Online Antisemitism
description: Elon Musk will attend an Auschwitz conference the European Jewish Association is holding next week to discuss online antisemitism, according to an invitation sent by the organizers.

title: Trump Moves to Quash Hopes of Ukraine-Border Deal in Congress
description: Former president and likely Republican nominee Donald Trump is moving to quash any hopes of a bipartisan compromise on immigration and Ukraine as the Senate prepares for votes as early as next week on a possible deal.

title: EU Assembly Boosts Pressure to Withhold Further Funds from Orban
description: The European Parliament called for withholding further European Union funds to Hungary until Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government satisfies all criteria aimed at reversing the erosion of the rule of law.

title: Ex-NYC Comptroller Scott Stringer Exploring Bid to Run for Mayor
description: Former New York City Comptroller Scott Stringer said he’s creating a campaign committee to raise money for a possible 2025 mayoral bid.

title: Posen Warns Peace Dividend Is Reversing as Global Tensions Rise
description: Adam Posen in Davos, on Jan. 18. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg

title: After Debt Revamp, Ghana Faces Pre-Election Spending Dilemma
description: As Ghana’s debt-restructuring talks approach their final stretch, the country’s leaders are facing a new dilemma.

title: Iran Missile Strikes Carry Warning for Israel
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Iran Frustrates Nuclear Monitors as Its Uranium Stockpile Grows
description: Iran is frustrating international efforts to examine its nuclear program as it speeds up its production of uranium enriched close to the level needed for weapons.

title: Navy Images Show Damage to Commodity Ship From Houthi Drones
description: The Indian Navy released images of a commodity carrier struck by a drone Wednesday in the Gulf of Aden.

title: Russia Rules Out Nuclear Arms Talks With US Over Ukraine Support
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov lashed the US over its support for Ukraine and warned on the risks of confrontation between nuclear powers as he ruled out any discussions on strategic security with Washington.

title: Sunak Warns UK Lords Not to ‘Frustrate’ Key Immigration Bill
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak challenged the House of Lords not to “frustrate” his flagship bill to enable the deportation of asylum seekers to Rwanda, warning that the policy is an “urgent national priority.”

title: Singapore Scandals Involving Ruling Party Politicians: Timeline
description: Singapore’s ruling People’s Action Party was dealt a fresh blow on Thursday when former Transport Minister S. Iswaran was charged for corruption, ending a storied political career.

title: Hungary Won’t Amend Asylum, LGBTQ Laws for EU Funds: Minister
description: Hungary won’t meet European Union demands to amend controversial laws on asylum seekers and on restricting LGBTQ content, a senior minister said, making it less likely that Budapest will be able to tap the remainder of the funds suspended by the bloc.

title: Northern Ireland Hit by Mass Strike Amid Political Deadlock
description: Public workers in Northern Ireland are taking part in a mass one-day strike to protest over public sector pay, a move expected to bring widespread disruption to the region.

title: Singapore Minister’s Graft Charges End Storied Political Career
description: S. Iswaran, the Singapore transport minister who resigned after facing graft charges, was in public service for more than a quarter of a century. It took just months for his storied career to unravel.

title: Philippine Defense Chief Dismisses Coup Rumors Against Marcos
description: The Philippines’ top defense official brushed aside coup rumors against President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., saying the nation’s military that has a history of ouster plots is professional and will follow the chain of command.

title: Indian Billionaires, Religion, Politics to Mix at Opening of Controversial Temple
description: Hundreds of pounds of traditional Indian sweets, private jets at a new airport, electric buses and a liquor ban are just some of the ways the holy town of Ayodhya is marking the opening of a controversial temple in four days time.

title: What Donald Trump’s Return Means for US Climate Ambition
description: The US looking out only for itself “shoots a hole in everything we’re trying to accomplish,” hedge-fund billionaire Tom Steyer says on this week’s Zero.

title: Saving Gaza Means Pressing Iran as Well as Israel
description: Escalation risk is growing as Netanyahu and the world talk past each other.

title: Singapore Ex-Minister’s Graft Charges: ‘Kinky Boots’ and Soccer
description: Former Singapore transport minister S. Iswaran faces 27 charges, including two counts of corruption, 24 counts of obtaining “valuable things” from someone he had business dealings with as a public servant, and one for obstructing justice. He said he is innocent.

title: Pakistan Retaliates With Strikes on Militant Targets in Iran
description: The Pakistani military carried out targeted strikes against militant hideouts in Iran after Tehran launched similar attacks the day before, in an escalation of tensions.

title: Biden Economic Adviser Mike Pyle Will Soon Leave the White House
description: Mike Pyle, a senior economic aide in President Joe Biden’s administration, is set to leave his role in the coming weeks, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Trump Tells New Hampshire Voters He’d ‘Never Allow’ a Federal Reserve Digital Dollar
description: Former President Donald Trump came out against the idea of a central bank-issued digital dollar, saying he wanted to “protect Americans from government tyranny.”

title: US and Chinese Financial Officials to Meet in Beijing for Talks
description: US and Chinese officials will meet in Beijing this week for financial talks, the latest sign of the improvement in ties between the world’s two largest economies.

title: What the Controversial Ram Temple Means for India’s Hindus and Muslims
description: On a plot of land in Ayodhya, a small city in northern India, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has achieved a long-standing goal that has created divisions between the country’s majority Hindu and minority Muslim populations for decades. The plot is home to the soon-to-be inaugurated Ram Mandir, a sprawling temple complex devoted to the Hindu god-king Ram. Devotees believe the temple site is Ram’s birthplace. It was formerly occupied by a 16th century mosque razed in 1992 by Hindu extremists. That a

title: US Bars Ex-Guatemalan President From Entry Due to Corruption
description: The US has barred former Guatemalan President Alejandro Giammattei from entry into the country due to his involvement in “significant corruption,” the State Department said in a statement Wednesday.

title: US Unleashes More Yemen Strikes as Houthi Attacks Continue
description: The US launched another round of strikes at 14 Houthi targets in Yemen overnight as the militant group’s attacks on shipping in the Red Sea continue.

title: Singapore Minister Appears in Court After Corruption Probe
description: Singapore Transport Minister S. Iswaran appeared in court after a graft probe, the latest development in the biggest political scandal to hit the city state in close to four decades.

title: UK’s Hunt to Meet Amazon, Alphabet Execs in Davos in Tech Push
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt plans to meet with Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc executives in Davos on Thursday as part of a push to spur investment in Britain’s technology sector.
